reviews.review:
One of the most thought provoking, engaging, and profound First Person Shooters out there! Bioshock Infinite is a wild ride SO CRAZY and COOL that I don't think I can talk about WHY it's so cool without giving spoilers!

Guide Elizabeth through a strange world as you fight off some SUPER bad people and get her to safety! But this is no "escort mission", Elizabeth can take care of herself! She even gives you Ammo and Health Packs! She can even revive you if you die in battle! HELL she's escorting YOUR dumbass!

A good game with a wonderful world that will occupy your thoughts for long after you finish it!

I wanted to write a small joke review for [i]Infinite[/i], but… There’s something to be said here.

When I played it back in 2013, I finished it in two days and for the next week was walking around with my jaw dangling around my ankles. Oh, what a visual style! Oh, how they twisted the plot! Oh, what an impactful story!

That is all true, but now after all these years and having replayed the game 3 times, I understand something very important for the understanding of [i]Infinite[/i] and [i]Bioshock[/i] in general. It’s an emotional rollercoaster. In both senses. On the one hand, it masterfully takes you from super-highs to super-lows and back, but on the other it pretty much sells you pre-made, pre-packed, pre-cooked emotions and squeezes them out of you with simplistic narrative contrasts, awe explosions and shock injections.  And that’s impressive but… Cheap.

There’s no subtlety, no nuance. The only nuanced thing in this game is probably the never-mentioned incestuous subtext, and even that might be something that wasn’t actualized simply because it was considered too obscene to shove in the player’s face.

Let me illustrate my point. The very first hour. Walking across the marvelous city. Celebration. Colorful fair. Bliss. Foreboding, but at the moment – glorious. People relax, eat, drink, chat, enjoy themselves. Then – the raffle, the culmination of the celebration, the singing, the merrymaking. And then – after a small ominous interlude – an atomic explosion of violence: right in the middle of the staring whooping crowd you peel off a man’s face with an industrial appliance. In the next two minutes you will kill two dozen arguably innocent people. I think it’s the most terrifyingly beautiful scene of contrastive violence I have ever seen not just in a game, but in any medium. This first hour and this scene carry the rest of the game on their shoulders. They set the tone in bronze, and this contrast will be repeated time after time. Without this massive Alpha impression it would play as a compelling TV-series rather than a compelling interactive experience.

[i]Infinite[/i] will always remain a landmark of my aesthetic scenery, but I also feel like I’ve been had. It’s beautiful, but it’s also a simple blockbuster. It made me feel for the characters in fantastical circumstances that are hard to relate to without cheap emotion-squeezing.

And it also intruded upon the old [i]BioShock[/i] in the DLCs. And that fact completely exposes it as an entertainment-first franchise.
Неплохо, хороший товар.

我这个常玩3D游戏的人都晃的有点想吐了，今天想玩又有点不敢玩，镜头设计的原因吧。游戏本身是非常棒的，虽然不是自由发展类型，但是画面剧情和音乐配上还是感觉很棒的。战斗剧情开始前的天空城有种奇奇怪怪的美好感觉，伊丽莎白也是个不错的角色，海边起舞确实想让人停留这一刻。后面剧情还没玩到，但这种线性剧情我有点想直接当电影看，操作是多余的，懒得动手反正都安排好了。总之这是一个值得期待的故事

A lot different than the first two games in terms of style, production. EA/2K involved so the combat is now low-key call of duty clone where 50 enemies flood your screen at once in these huge open environments instead of the close-knit halls of Rapture you're used to but it's not terrible. The narrative of this game I felt focused a bit to much on dialogue, being the first Bioshock where the character you play as speaks, and the halls and moment to moment gameplay told less story and was less atmospheric than the first two. I would still say this game held my attention for how long it took me to beat it, and I had fun with it. Was kind of shorter than I expected! Might try some of the modes you unlock or multiplayer if I'm fiending for me Bioshock.
Its totally Fun. You should really play it

7 years on and still a Brilliant game. I remember buying Bioshock Infinite release month on my PS3 and loving every moment of it. It was easily one of the best games of 2013 and I'm still really happy to say that it holds up today and is definitely worth playing through. At a sale price this game is a must have. The story is unique enough to keep you fascinated, the chemistry between the characters of Booker and Elizabeth are very well written and the gameplay feels fresh and the most fast paced bioshock game today. The game looks amazing even to todays standards and the world feels lived in.

My only real drawback or peave from the experience of Bioshock Infinite is the lack of Gun variety to use at once. In Bioshock 1 you can cary 7 weapons and in Bioshock 2 you can cary 6 weapons. Infinite however breaks the weapon wheel trend and instead only allows you to carry two weapons at a time. To some players this wont matter to them but to me its a real annoyance. Yes there are a lot more weapons in Infinite but at least let me cary 5 weapons so there can be more variety in each encounter. I tend to stick with the same weapons as they are the most effective in encounters such as the RPG meaning that a lot of the weapons which are not quite as good, I never really touch. I constantly have to decide whether or not to keep a weapon. Also the Vending machines are pointless in Infinite. No longer do you have to worry about health or shields or salt when Elizabeth just so happens to always have what you need at the right moment. To me this just makes the game a little too easy for my liking. In Bioshock 1 and 2 it really feels like every resource is valuable and all purchases are important. This feeling is not in Infinite. That is my only drawback from the game but it does'nt take away from the brilliant experience that is Bioshock Infinite.

Play it as though 1 and 2 never existed. I didn't quite like the beginning or the end, but overall the game was enjoyable. Why I didn't like the beginning is because it felt kinda odd after playing the first two back to back, kinda like a new pair of shoes. The middle was pretty neat for reasons I will not go into. The end was uh...I dunno chief, it was kinda funny. 
Edit - Funny as in, don't play this for the story because there's no real resolution unless you're the philosophical type who really enjoys time travel plots.
Edit 2 - I can only assume Burial at Sea was made because people got mad BS-I took place in a sky city. Though due to the rift shift story that BS-I took, BaS might as well be in a sky city. Usually it's the little things that get me, I liked the hacking because it provided something else to do besides just blasting everyone into bits. (Which was also fun don't get me wrong.)
Me gusto mucho el juego, tiene buena historia, buena jugabilidad y tanto las bandas sonoras como las vistas son muy entretenidas y de calidad

This game has a nice atmosphere, a very good story, and there are plenty of weapons to use.  I recommend this game, but I warn that this game is different from the two previous games.  As a diehard fan of the originals, It took a second playthough and an open mind for me to not judge this game against the other two.  
- I have not played the DLC on console or steam. 
- From my experience, people who play this before playing 1 and 2, have a better experience with it.

Поиграй я в эту игру в 2013 когда я ее купил по фул прайсу, а не сейчас, думаю было бы здорово, но, увы, геймплейно в 2020-ом было скучновато. Сюжет добротный. Нету впечатления "а не пройти ли бы мне это еще 100500 раз" как у большинства, ибо с первого раза для меня получилось все понятным, но проходить мимо не рекомендую, потому что это хорошая замена сериалам, соц. сетям и мультиплеерным играм на несколько вечеров.

I thought I'd put this game in my wishlist due to the critical acclaim as mentioned in Wikipedia and by the reviews here, so I jumped at the opportunity to buy it when it went on sale. However, I just find that this game has a lot of meaningless shooting without a strong story to engage the player in. It was just constantly needing to go to places with no end in sight and without any cutscenes to break up the immediate goals. I don't feel engaged enough to continue playing this game. There were other games that kept me engaged for 6 or more continuous hours right from the start. This game is not one of them.
Recomendadisimo, experiencia inolvidable

Nothing like the Bioshock series, these games are all amazing. If you've never played any video games, these are the ones to play. Everything from atmosphere to gameplay is executed perfectly. This game and the others in the series are perfection in a video game. Buy and enjoy.

Never before in my history of gaming has one game series like the BioShock franchise made me so depressed, all the while happy, and entertained simultaneously. This game is rich with great storytelling to the point that this game successfully gave me a jaw-dropper, which games are very, VERY rarely able to execute. Plenty of more elements about this game's epicness can be shared, but only with spoilers, which I will not tell. Which is why I encourage, implore, and beseech the reader to purchase this game (including all DLC's for maximum epicness and [spoiler] D E P R E S S I O N [/spoiler]). BioShock Infinite is the prime example of how to execute a prologue to an existing series, while not having a predictable outcome.

500/10 would highly recommend.
Some anti-depressants would help too

On the one hand, the story is amazing and the world is striking. On the other hand, I'm not a fan of first-person shooters so I found the gameplay tedious. On the other *other* hand, I killed a ghost with a rocket and it was awesome.

[h1]Игра, которую берёшь скорее ради персонажей, чем ради геймплея[/h1]

Мне интересно, как может не понравится сюжет в данной игре.
Допустим геймплей (ну обычная стрельба, в стиле всех шутеров + особый стиль bioshock), но сюжет - извольте.

Я всегда прохожу игры с классической озвучкой и языком, но если есть желание - могу и с русским (чего не скажешь о DLC - игра 13-14 года, а они не озвучены :/ )
В общем русская озвучка неплохая, в целом подходит под мимику персонажей.

Сложность в игре - это жoпa, честно.
Поставь высокий - всё равно что выбросить 75% патронов, еды, солей и т.д. из игры.
Противники резко становятся твердолобыми (ака мафиозник из человека-паука)
В голову из дроби урон идёт как будто с рогатки в ухо попадаешь.

В игре явно не хватает вариативности, хотя бы маленькой - выборы по типу "какую медальку повесить Элизабет на шею" решают ровно ничего, хотя от этого и зависит с какой она будет в DLC.

[b]Эх, хотелось бы чтобы она не заканчивалась...[/b]

Lo compre con una cierta duda sin saber si me gustaria o no, y la verdad es que me ha fascinado. No solo por los sistemas tecnicos, graficos, sistema de armas, jugabilidad y banda sonora, si no tambien por su historia la cual me ha encantado de principio a fin, incluso recien con el motivo de continuar jugandolo me compre todos los dlcs disponibles que hay, sin duda un juegazo que deberian probar! 10/10 le doy, completamente maravilloso!

I have so many complex feelings towards this game. I finished it one night prior to this review, and I postponed talking about it because I needed time to think. Never, in all of my history of gaming, had I been left shocked and speechless by the finale of a game. Among the rigorous action and vials of vigors, there is an extremely complex narrative expertly written into Bioshock Infinite, and it is well worth the price being asked.

엔딩까지 플레이시간은 8시간 걸렸습니다. 
기본 한글로 하지 않았고 , 유저한글패치를 다운받아서 플레이 했습니다.

시작 도입부부터 아름다운 풍경과 약 7년전 출시된 게임이라고는 생각들지 않을정도로
그래픽이었습니다. 처음엔 많은 npc들의 대사가 자막으로 나오고, 또 자막의 크기가 너무작아서
이걸 다읽어야하는건지 하는 혼동이 왔습니다.

하지만 인트로부분이 끝난이후로은 오히려 그런 대사들 마저 게임에 집중하게 만들었습니다.
게임 내용에 대해선 스포이기 때문에 남기지 않겠습니다.
다만 1, 2를 아주 오래전에 플레이했엇던 유저로서
엔딩부에 다다랐을때 1,2 의 장면이 나올때엔 정말 소름이 돋았습니다.

평소 게임에 리뷰를 자주 남기는 편은 아니지만, 이번 세일에 구매한 게임에
8시간에 엔딩이었지만, 이번주말에 충분히 즐길수 있어서 오히려 스토리에 집중되는 느낌이어서
너무 좋았습니다. 바이오쇼크는 왠만한 게이머들은 플레이해보았을거라고 생각이들지만
플레이하지않았다면, 한번도 플레이 안한 머리로 게임을 플레이할수있다는게
부럽습니다.
